comments.commentBody: It is not to their advantage to stand up to him. They've got a list, just like Santa. Their naughty is the services to people who need them, Medicare, Social Security, climate change and science, and all; their nice is more tax cuts for the rich, deregulation, and more favors to big fossil who pay for their campaigns.
Finally someone  that makes sense! Good job.

Keep inventing new ones? There are so many that can invented and always requiring more and more skills. What will happen to the masses of people who cannot keep up? What if the new invented jobs do not come? Instead of alleviating hardship, automation has helped the expansion of precocity of employment, particularly at lower levels that keep being automated. Now it is the middle classes and clerks' turn. Boring jobs, yes, but jobs. How are we going to eat, survive and perhaps consume if there are no jobs? Will fixed life income be distributed among the population as greater and greater proportions are displaced and become unemployed and unemployable? A distopia in the making.
In a city that is 37% white and 47% black how did a jury with one black person on it represent a jury of his peers? This trial was rigged from the start to result in a mistrial.
Way to echo Trump's signature word.  Sad.

The obvious,ominous and odious conclusion here,is that injustice has initially prevailed.Some sinister circumstance tells me I must reject,ignore and dismiss what I just saw with my own two eyes.This bizarre compulsion is at the root of the menace that threatens contemporary America.Vote suppression strategies that we are told are for our own good,contradict internal perceptions of profound fraud.Traffic stop mayhem that leads,all too often,to sanctioned murder by law enforcement 'officers,dissuades dispassionately and deter minately against some Americans concepts of  the righteous integrity of the lauded and applauded American judicial 'system.IF the videotaped massacre of an American citizen is not an automatic condemnation of personal atrocity in American society,then we may as well cease to exist as a civilized community.Sadly and soberingly,this is exactly where some seek to steer 'US...the Dark Ages.

These police are no longer representative of the people. I have lived a long life and only in recent years have cops been emptying their guns as they shoot to kill unarmed citizens. Then they get protection in the injustice system.
It is inevitable that without real change more good police will die by being ambushed by outraged citizens. When the forces charged with keeping the peace are stone cold killers above the law - there anarchy and chaos comes.
One can see in the video the police officer dropping his taser on the ground next to the body.

a great idea I've wondered about for years. but then the health care greed mongers try all the scare tactics about "rationing care" and "death panels" and everyone thinks spending $200K for some idiotic cancer treatment like I saw advertised during a football game last weekend that extends the average patients life a grand total of 6 WEEKS is a great idea if it happens to be them with the disease. at that rate, a years treatment costs $1.73M per year. so somebody can live another 6 weeks on average. ridiculous.

employers should be able to offer plans that offer solid basic care but specifically preclude this sort of drug company grand larceny to all employees and if the higher paid ones want to *buy* additional coverage to subsidize this type of highly unlikely criminality then let them knock themselves out. it would also spread the cost of ripoff priced drugs over a smaller population making them pay the entire bill for the drugs and making their accompanying premiums rise even more as the poor would no longer be subsidizing the rich. and all they'd be giving up is 6 weeks were an incredibly unlikely event to occur. lets see how fast the next drug company criminal increases the price for his drug from $10 to $17000 (as one did couple weeks ago) when the pool of chumps to subsidize his naked greed just shrunk by 70%.
I am very impressed by your careful reasoning and totally support you im voting your moral beliefs.   Thank you for having the courage of your convictions.
I hope the writer's careful, patriotic reasoning can help sway other Electors.

It was my understanding that the very thing that distinguishes a persons guilt for murder from manslaughter is: malice, timing and intent. 1. Malice: in this case,in my humble opinion, The malice could be presented that the police officer took it upon himself to express his anger that a man (regardless of race) had the audacity to defy his orders and maybe had even fought with him. I am in no way excusing that this altercation very well could have happened, and if it did it was non-compliant and wrong on the case of Mr. Scott but, it did not warrant him being shot eight times in the back as punishment. 2. Timing: did the officer have ample time to challenge his irrational thoughts of killing Mr. Scott as a punishment for his disobedience while he was clearly running away? In my humble opinion, a resounding yes. The officer had ample enough time with each step that his so called " clear and present danger" was steadily and surely moving in a direction away from him. If a normal everyday citizen like you an I would ever be involved in a fight where our opponent clearly has given up and decides to run and you or I take it upon ourselves to pull out a gun and shoot that person in the back we will be convicted of murder if the jury in our case follows the rule of law in determining there verdict. 3. intent: In my humble opinion, intent can be proved by a trained public servant swore in to protect and served chooses to not shoot a man 8 times in the back not to stop but to kill.

As in so many of these cases, whatever the victim did wrongly, it did not deserve a death sentence with the police officer as judge, jury, and executioner.

And in the cases of Tamir Rice and John Crawford, their videos show they were doing absolutely nothing wrong.

He does not know the difference between a lie and the truth. He has no concept of such, lying as we call it, is just another way of doing business with him.
He has swindled contractors, workers, other investors by lying to them that they will get paid what he signed for, there are hundreds of court cases to prove that. He considers bankruptcy a normal way of doing business. He will not produce his tax records as they will show he is a fraud.

The voter fraud thing is for his followers, they believe it, they believe the stories about all the Mexicans crossing the border, he plays on ignorance and hate, it is the mark of a sociopath. He has no concept of right and wrong, to him, they are what ever he says they are.

He exhibits several characteristics of a sociopath. Does not smile, takes offense to criticism, tries to censor any humor related to his actions. Gives commands to all, doe not ask for cooperation, demands it. He has gotten away with it with his employees and expects the rest of us to behave the same.

We need to do our best to make him go bonkers, and watch the show when he breaks down. Make him the but of jokes and insults by the hour, do not let up, he will crack.

This is yet another failure of the justice system.  But in this case the erasure of the facts and the denial of truth is beyond breathtaking.  How are any of us to believe that there's a chance of justice for people not considered to be  white. I just don't know.

Indeed, were it not for the Constitutional prohibition on double jeopardy, we could probably "get the desired result" with most any defendant by continuing to retry her. That would be a singular day for all "right-minded", or perhaps left-minded, folk!
Correct. Thank you.

Dylann Roof? You mean the guy the state declined a life-without-parole plea proposal from in favor of trying to execute him? The one who's getting off easy, you mean?

You certainly don't mean the 3 bored black teens who gunned down a white jogger in Oklahoma for kicks, and who were not charged with a hate crime.

Elizabeth, you suggest that Slager should get every detail right in describing this confrontation. He testified his mind was like spaghetti, which sounds believable to me. You take every inconsistency as an indication of cold-blooded murder. But a juror has to give him the benefit of the doubt. You're a good prosecutor of Slager. But you'd be a biased juror. You probably dislike police officers, as many do. That would disqualify you from the jury.

Diane: when anyone knows what the verdict should have been from 2000 miles from the courtroom, proclaiming that any or all of the jurors were wrong, they forget about the presumption of innocence.
Alabama, South Carolina, who cares? It's all the same to uninformed Times commenters writing tendentiously.
Thats where the qualifier bitterly comes in.
No. That's the guy in Texas who's refusing to vote the overwhelming choice of his fellow state residents because, well, he's just such a principled guy.
To Chris: No, not God, WE will judge and punsih Slager. Stay strong.

At least there's one individual here-the judge, Clifton Newman-who knows his obligations under law and observes them. For all the commenters crying racism, start here: Judge Newman is indisputably black.
So is Clarence Thomas, what's your point Cletus?
You are are not wrong website.  For Breitbart and Faux News, take a sharp right.

Erin, admit it, you have absolutely no idea how Dr. Carson will do at this job.  He raised himself out of the gutter of the inner city, so he at least has that experience going for him.  If he can overcome your negativity, he'll have a great chance at succeeding.  He wanted the chance, whichnis a lot more than you can say.
